primary-use-case.description: Analyzing photos and videos to detect manipulated media and misinformation
primary-use-case.justification: SatyaCheck's primary purpose is to help users identify potential misinformation in digital content, which inherently requires analyzing photos and videos shared by users. This application specifically needs to examine media files to detect signs of manipulation, doctoring, or misleading context.
primary-use-case.frequency: Regular access to user-selected media is required for the app's core misinformation detection functionality. The app analyzes images and videos on-demand when users submit them for verification.
